definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the founder of China's modern aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 王國維是中國現代美學的奠基者。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the first person to achieve modern transformation of academic research in China.
sentences.chinese: 王國維是中國學術研究實現現代轉型的第一人。

sentences.english: The philosophy and aesthetics of Wang Guo-wei are deeply effected by Schopenhauer.
sentences.chinese: 王國維的哲學和美學思想深受叔本華的影響。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is a great man of letters in modern and contemporary Chinese history in academy.
sentences.chinese: 王國維是中國近現代學術史上的巨靈。

sentences.english: WangGuowei's "natural" can be divided into two levels.
sentences.chinese: 王國維的“自然”文藝觀可分爲兩個層次。

sentences.english: The suffering doctrine is the theory basis of life speculation of Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: “苦痛”說是王國維人生思辨的理論基點。

sentences.english: Dual Personality manifests itself most strikingly in Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: 雙重人格在王國維身上有着鮮明的體現。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei occupies a unique place in the History of Chinese Aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 王國維在中國美學史上有獨特的地位。

sentences.english: Ms. Ye Jiaying has a profound elaboration of Mr. Wang Guowei's "theory of realm".
sentences.chinese: 葉嘉瑩先生對王國維的境界說作了深刻的闡發。

sentences.english: It is thus note-worthy that various reasons contribute to the death of Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: 應該注意到，王國維的自殺是多種原因綜合造成的。

sentences.english: He breaks with Peking University due to his connection with the royal family of the former Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 因與清室的關係，王國維又與北京大學斷交。

definition: Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to comment/a point by point commentary
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
